title: 114_hr2273
content: AUTHORITY TO MAKE ENTIRE ACTIVE CAPACITY OF FONTENELLE RESERVOIR AVAILABLE FOR USE. The Secretary of the Interior, in cooperation with the State of Wyoming, may amend the Definite Plan Report for the Seedskadee Project to enable the use of all active storage capacity of Fontenelle Dam and Reservoir, including necessary construction activities. The Secretary may also enter into cooperative agreements for this purpose. The Secretary of the Interior will enter into a cooperative agreement with the State of Wyoming for planning and construction activities related to the modification of the Fontenelle Dam. The agreement will specify the responsibilities of both parties in completing the planning and final construction. The Secretary of the Interior will enter into a cooperative agreement with the State of Wyoming for planning and final design of the modification of the Fontenelle Dam, including environmental and cultural resource compliance activities required. The State of Wyoming must provide funds to the Secretary of the Interior for work on the Fontenelle Dam modification. The Secretary may also enter contracts with Wyoming for division of additional storage capacity. Terms and conditions will be agreed upon by both parties. The contract entered into between the Secretary of the Interior and the State of Wyoming for work on the Fontenelle Dam modification is subject to specific terms and conditions outlined in Bureau of Reclamation Contract No. 14-06-400-2474 and No. 14-06-400-6193. SEC. 2. SAVINGS PROVISIONS. The Act does not modify or affect various existing laws and agreements related to water management, including the Boulder Canyon Project Act, the Colorado River Compact, the Boulder Canyon Project Adjustment Act, the Treaty with Mexico on water utilization, and the Upper Colorado River Basin Compact. The Act of April 6, 1949, the Act of April 11, 1956 (Colorado River Storage Project Act), the Colorado River Basin Project Act, and State water laws are not affected by the Act. The House of Representatives passed the Act on July 5, 2016. Karen L. Haas attested to it as the Clerk.
